fields.description:
I'm trying to query activity that occurred before Sun Nov 16 2014 09:27:04 GMT+0800. I'm GETing the following activity feed URL:

https://jira.salsitasoft.com/activity?streams=last-update-date+BEFORE+1416101224469&os_authType=basic

However, when I check the results, I can see the first entry has 

<updated>2014-11-19T13:58:51.000Z</updated>

Which is obviously too new for what I'd expect my query to return.

GETing https://jira.salsitasoft.com/rest/activity-stream/1.0/config shows me the "update-date" parameter should be recognized and that it should accept the "after" and "before" operators.

The query filters correctly if I modify the URL to filter according to a user name as well:

https://jira.salsitasoft.com/activity?streams=user+IS+tomas.brambora&streams=update-date+BEFORE+1415239412779&os_authType=basic

**TL;DR**
It appears the update-date filter is dropped when used exclusively.
fields.summary: Watch JIRA activity feed update-date filtering not working when used as the only filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41002].
  {panel}

As more and more people use Jira for non-development purposes many of us have 100's of shared filters.

At the moment the fact that you have to individually go into each filter to update permissions makes this very unmaintainable and can take hours to make these changes.

Please could you implement:-

1) Capability to select multiple filters and edit permissions
fields.summary: Unable to bulk edit shared filter permsissions

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Generate 16,000 groups in Jira 6.3.8
# Load up the edit users group JQuery box in IE 9 ( /admin/user/editUsersGroups )
-- the {{appendChild}}'s function takes *13s+* to complete
# Click on cancel button
-- the {{removeChild}}'s function takes *17s+* to complete

h4.Actual Results
The IE 9/10 browser will returns timeout error while loading or canceling the dialog box.

h4.Expected Results
Users expecting the similar profiling results as in Chrome or Firefox which take < 2s.

h4.Profiling data
* [^ProfData_IE9_cancelDialog.csv]
* [^ProfData_IE9_browseGroup.csv]
fields.summary: IE 9/10 timing out when loading large list of groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41000].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a connector type/delegated LDAP directory
# Change to {{"ldap.user.username": "cn"}}
# Setup a user with multiple cn attribute, for example: _usera_, _userb_, _userc_
# Perform synchronisation
# Login using _usera_, _userb_, _userc_

*Actual Behaviour*
Only the first cn can be login

*Expected Behaviour*
All cn user suppose to be able to login
fields.summary: Support multiple cn login for LDAP users
Links/titles of dialogs in issue view are not compatible with ADG
Publish or Discard Draft message should also be shown in the Workflow Properties edit screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40997].
  {panel}

This seems to be caused by the bugfix for: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40310

In 6.3.9 and later, you can no longer add a comment in a transition screen if the destination status has {{jira.permission.comment.user}} set to {{false}} or {{denied}}. The message below is displayed in a red banner when you try to transition the issue:
_<username>, you do not have the permission to comment on this issue._

This should not be the case because the comment permission property should be based on the CURRENT status of the issue. To put it in simply, the transition was not yet executed so adding a comment should be allowed.
fields.summary: Cannot add comment in transition screen if destination status has jira.permission.comment.user set to false

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For *{color:#FF0000}every page load{color}* the Welcome plugin (What's new) checks if the user has admin permission on any project. This is crazy expensive for large installations, some have > 100 projects.

In performance tests this shows to consume > 21% of all CPU.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access any page within JIRA.

h3. Expected Results

The page loads normally and causes no additional performance overhead.

h3. Actual Results

The CPU spikes significantly and {{com.atlassian.jira.whatsnew.context.WhatsNewContextProvider.isUserProjectAdmin(final User user)}} is checked in order to know what link to present. This check should be deferred until the link is clicked (which happens approximately never) and the destination checked at that time.

h3. Diagnosis

There will be a number of references to the {{com.atlassian.jira.whatsnew.context.WhatsNewContextProvider.isUserProjectAdmin(final User user)}} in the thread dumps, for example the below thread shows us this could be problematic:

{noformat}

  10 jira_threads.1410383009.txt:
  14 jira_threads.1410383020.txt:
  17 jira_threads.1410383032.txt:

h3. Workaround

# Go to *Cog icon > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons*.
# At the filter, change "User-installed" to "System".
# Look for the JIRA Welcome Plugin.
# Disable the plugin. This will prevent it loading on every page.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
- Entering text into text-field, such as "Description", and then open other context menu (by doing the right-click)
- Press *Esc* button
- It will close both *Description* field and the right-click menu all at once, causing the entered data to be erased without being saved
- This behavior is applied to *text-field*.

It would be great if JIRA close the right-click menu first, and will only close the description text-field after the user press Esc button again. This way, it will give the user a chance to save the text in the text-field.
fields.summary: "Escape/Esc" button should not close the text-field window and right-click menu, all at once

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40990].
  {panel}

The changelog should be more customizable than it is atm. One basic idea from a users point of view would be to be able to add filters to changelogs. This would cover a bunch of requested usecases to customize the changelog page.

In my case I only want to display external issues in the changelog (aka: those which can be seen by users and are not internal bugs/issues which do not directly surface to the user).
For that I've added a custom field ("Is user visible") which is being set for issues which should be contained in the changelog.

If I could set a filter for the changelog, that'd be all I need so that internal issues are not listed on the changelog page.

Other usecases which could be done with this approach:
- only list issues with a priority >= major in the list
- exclude subtasks from the changelog
- do not list tasks in the changelog
- etc.
fields.summary: Using filters to create changelogs.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status – 03 January 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi,

Thanks for all your votes and comments on this suggestion. I'm sorry we haven't provided feedback on it earlier. We fully understand the value it would provide to you.

The good news is that in the next Jira Server release you will find the "Development" column in Issue Navigator, which will contain the most important development information for an issue including commits, pull requests, builds and deployments.

Best,
 agenkin@atlassian.com
 Anton Genkin | Product Manager - Integrations
{panel}

The issue navigator provides a "pseudo" field called "Links" that shows the issue keys to which a given issue is linked. This is very convenient, since the linked issues can then be reviewed in a tabular layout, exported, etc.

I am looking for similar fields for information shown in the dev panel - i.e. "Linked Changesets" (commits), "Linked Reviews", etc.
fields.summary: As a user of the issue navigator, I want to use "pseudo" fields such as "Linked Reviews, "Linked Changesets" etc. to be able to add developent panel contents to query results.

  {panel}

There is a mismatch between Closing an Epic and marking it as Done.
In my opinion either of the two should automatically do the other.

I can't mark a Closed Epic as Done anymore, since our Closed issues are read-only. This means I have to reopen (Issue View) -> mark as done (Agile View) -> close (Issue View). This is not very user-friendly and people tend to forget to Mark as Done anyway.

After I Mark as Done, the Epic no longer shows up in the Epic lists, so if it isn't Closed automatically, these issues are difficult to track down. They will show up in simple open/closed statistics, skewing results.
fields.summary: Closing Epic does not mark it as Done

fields.description:
When using a mail handler with Default Reporter set and a user that does not have permission to create an issue tries to create one via mail, that issue is never created and the following error appears on {{atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log}}:
{noformat}
2014-11-20 17:20:57,806 WARN [Atlassian] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 ServiceRunner    Create Issue Create Issue[10000]: Reporter (jirauser) does not have permission to create an issue. Message rejected.
{noformat}
This doesn't make much sense when you consider anyone else can create the issue via email, except users that are in JIRA but without the necessary permissions.

*Steps to reproduce*
Set a mail handler to create issues with Default Reporter
Send mail to the handler from a user without permissions to create issue on the project

*Expected behavior*
Default reporter creates the issue with it's own credential on behalf of that user.

*Actual Behavior* 
Message is rejected because user does have permission to create it.

If we have the group "Anyone" in the permissions the problem still happens for disabled users
fields.summary: User without permission to create an issue is not able to create via mail when a default reporter is set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40974].
  {panel}

The ability introduced in JIRA 6.2.x to allow users (not just admins) to import from .CSV files really needs some other limiting factor beyond "Create Issue" project permission and "Bulk Edit" global permission.  Importing is not the same as bulk editing.

Importing via .CSV can easily go wrong spawning tons of errors, especially for those who have little experience formatting them.  This can cause all types of problems throughout the entire JIRA instance.  And while most users would like the ability to import issues as it is an easier way for them to enter issues, most either will not take the time to correctly format their import, read how to do so or pre-test the import before they do so.  This can be very, very bad.

So personally, as my companies system administrator, I have to make the choice of taking the risk to allow them this function (since they require the "Create Issue" ability in their own projects and they use Bulk Editing, turn off bulk editing which they have used for 2 1/2 years, or not upgrade above the 6.1.x series.  At present, only the latter is a viable solution.

Please add additional abilities for system administrators to limit the use of bulk importing (like it's own global permission setting)
fields.summary: "Import Issues" function should have additional permission requirements

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Download and install JIRA
# Run _<JIRA_INSTALL>/bin/config.sh -c_ in command line
# Select option 'D' for database configuration
# Select option 'S' for "SQL Server (MS-SQL)"

*Expected Results*
Continue with database configuration for MS-SQL server

*Actual Results*
* Receive message "Unknown command 'S'"
* Return to 'Database Selection' portion of config.sh script

Screenshot of problem:
!MSSQL config.sh Problem.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*
Utilize documentation for [manually configuring JIRA with MS-SQL Server| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2012#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2012-3.ConfigureYourJIRAServertoConnecttoYourSQLServer2012Database]:

{quote}*Manual Configuration*
# Locate the dbconfig.xml file at the root of your JIRA Home Directory.
#* If this file does not exist, create the file, copy and paste the example XML code ( shown below ) into this file.
# Update the file, as described in the Database connection fields section below. Escape any '&' characters by adding 'amp;' to the end of each one.
#* Note, the <database-type/> element must specify your type of database, e.g. mssql. If you forget to do this and you start JIRA, your database tables may be created incorrectly. See Incorrect database type specified if this happens to you.
# Save the file and restart JIRA.{quote}
fields.summary: MSSQL Selection in config.sh Broken (CLI)

fields.description:
Original Issue: [JSP-210949|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-210949]: Uncaught TypeError loading JIRA Agile Dashboard

Relevant versions: JIRA 6.3.9, JIRA Agile 6.6.13, jira-inline-issue-create 0.2.7 

*TLDR*
My theory is a Marionnette version mismatch.  Not sure how to chase that down though, I haven't ramped on how JIRA+plugins assembles JS resources.  I can see Marionnette is bundled with the plugin and has the missing method/property... perhaps it's overridden by another plugin that bundles an older version?

Original conditions reported result in 4 exceptions...
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'appendChild' of null batch.js:110
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'Layout' of undefined batch.js?locale=en-US&hipchatToken=true&isAdmin=true:119289
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'appendChild' of null batch.js:110

Customer disabled JIRA Calendar plugin and the errors were no longer visible.  I reproduced this and found two exceptions remaining though the error no longer appears in the UI.  These two appear to be the true problems.

*Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function*
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin/src/c510de7041b59e0dd0244a51d2cf548b4b01d6fd/plugin/src/main/resources/inline-issue-create/lib/backbone.marionette/backbone.marionette-amd.js?at=jira-inline-issue-create-parent-0.2.7#cl-5

*Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'Layout'*
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-inline-issue-create-plugin/src/c510de7041b59e0dd0244a51d2cf548b4b01d6fd/plugin/src/main/resources/inline-issue-create/components/inline-issue-create-widget/views/widget.js?at=jira-inline-issue-create-parent-0.2.7#cl-15

Cheers,
Morgan Knicely
Atlassian Support - Austin, TX

*Custom field definitions:*

- 20031 = 11.2014

*There will be only shown the ids of the fields:*
{code}
<customfield id="customfield_10511" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion">
<customfieldname>Delivery Version</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues>
<customfieldvalue>20022</customfieldvalue>
<customfieldvalue>20031</customfieldvalue>

<customfield id="customfield_10511" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion">

<customfieldvalues>

</customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
{code}

fields.description:
*Problem description:*

On an active JIRA, concurrent read access to links (such as when an issue is being displayed) and write access to links (such as when a new link or sub-task is created or deleted) may result in errors: 
* when a link/subtask is created, and this problem happens, the link/subtask will not be displayed at the parent issue (even after creation succeeds)
* when a subtask (or linked issue) is deleted, the parent task “breaks”, the issue page displays an error and there’s a NullPointerException in the server log.

This is a race condition, so exact reproduction sequence is hard to define. However, I managed to reproduce the problem with 100% certainty using debugger and running JIRA on Postres.

*Investigation:*

DefaultIssueLinkManager has a global per-instance cache of the inward/outward links. It is not transactional, and shared between threads that run transactional changes on the database, and threads that do reading. As a result, the following may happen:

# Thread 1: change transaction starts
# Thread 1: DefaultIssueLinkManager performs a write operation on a link in the DB
# Thread 1: cleans the cache for affected issues
# Thread 2: requests getInwardLinks or getOutwardLinks from DefaultIssueLinkManager for the affected issue
# Thread 2: because Thread 1’s transaction is not committed yet, old state is read and saved in the cache
# Thread 1: commits the transaction
# Thread 1 or any other thread: calls getInwardLinks or getOutwardLinks - but gets corrupt cached value, which relates to the state before the transaction has committed.

*How to reproduce using debugger:*

# Start JIRA instance with Postgres - I couldn’t reproduce on HSQL
# Create issue X and sub-task S
# Prepare a class with a piece of code that would a) start a new thread, b) in the thread, request getOutwardLinks() for a specified issue ID, c) wait for the thread to finish.
# Place a breakpoint in DefaultIssueDeleteHelper.deleteIssue(), on the line {{removeIssueLinks(user, issue);}}
# In JIRA, delete sub-task S — catch the breakpoint in debugger.
# Step over “removeIssueLinks”. Inside, the links will be removed, and cache will be cleared several times.
# Before continuing, use debugger’s Evaluate feature to call the prepared method that retrieves outward links _in another thread_ - call it on the parent issue X.
# Then you can verify that IssueLinkManager’s cache will contain an invalid entry for issue X with the link that has just been deleted.
# In JIRA web interface, if you open the parent issue’s page, there will be errors, and there will be an NPE in the log.

*Note that this is only an example* - the same problem can happen in most any place where links cache is being invalidated. 

The NPE:
{code:collapsed=true}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-11-19 03:50:24,925 http-bio-2990-exec-19 ERROR admin 230x15313x1 890nfl fe80:0:0:0:cae0:ebff:fe18:7e59%4 /secure/AjaxIssueAction!default.jspa [atlassian.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager] Could not evaluate condition 'com.atlassian.plugin.web.conditions.AndCompositeCondition@477a8ce9' for descriptor: com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:view-subtasks (null)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.NullPointerException
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.doIssuePermissionCheck(DefaultPermissionManager.java:283)

[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:90)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor542.invoke(Unknown Source)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:83)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy9.hasPermission(Unknown Source)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultSubTaskManager.getSubTaskBean(DefaultSubTaskManager.java:391)

{code}

*Workaround:*
If you are seeing this error on issues, please refer to https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/mhDtKQ.

Our organisation has using JIRA for issue logging for few years now.  Due to the nature of issue logging, business need to produce monthly, qtrly report, type of report also have business unit breakdow, like unresolved issues are older than 3 months by each business unit.  
When we have internal restructure, all those queries/filters are broken, because the queries/filters use specific custom field (those custom field are selected list).  We have total over  50+ filters built with those custom fields.  
If will be great if there is a varible function can be use in filters.

More details can refer to JSP-202890 ticket.

fields.description:
h5. Original Description:
JIRA 6.3 introduced a Hide Transition condition to hide the transition on the GUI but allowing to be called it from another workflow function or program.

However this latter doesn't work. I have 2 plugins that fails to trigger a transition that uses this condition: Jira workflow toolbox and jira automation.

h5. Answer
Indeed the *Hide transition from user* condition was added in JIRA 6.3.3. This condition will always fail, causing the Transition to never be available to be called manually. This was created in order to extend the usage [of Workflow Triggers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+workflow+configuration#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-triggers], in order to make certain transitions only possible through triggers (not manually):
{quote}
Triggers are events which initiate an automatic workflow transition for a JIRA issue. Examples of triggers are pull request creation, or code review rejection.

Caveats: Conditions, validators, and permissions will be ignored for automatic transitions but operate as usual for manual transitions. Global transitions can be automated with triggers, if you follow some simple guidelines. [Read our best practices page|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-063/Advanced+workflow+configuration] on automatic issue transitioning.
{quote}

Third-party plugins trying to transition an issue will indeed not be able to do so, nor will the REST API work.
fields.summary: Hide Transition doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
h4. Summary:
When attaching files to an issue, JIRA allows us to drag and drop the files directly to the _Attach Files_ screen. However, when dragging more than one file together, it's not working and no errors are being shown.

h4. Steps to replicate:
- Open any created ticket in JIRA 6.3.7 or 6.3.8;
- Go to _More > Attach Files_;
- Drag more than one file to the "Attachment" area of the opened screen - nothing happens.

*P.S.:* After perform the same steps in JIRA 6.3.9, everything worked properly.
fields.summary: Problem dragging more than one file at once to be attached
Reuse of custom fields for performance and maintainability

fields.description:
h4. Summary
JIRA allows the Base URL to be configured with upper case letters (e.g. http://LOCALHOST:8080). However, as per the URI RFC (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986), the domain name is *case insensitive* - e.g. if you type http://LOCALHOST:8080 in most recent browsers, they automatically convert the domain to lowercase (tested on Firefox 32.0.3, Safari Version 7.1 and Chrome Version 38.0.2125.111).

h4. Steps to Replicate:
# Following the steps on the [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options], change the JIRA Base URL to contain upper case letters in the domain name (e.g. http://LOCALHOST:8080/jira).
# Access JIRA via the new base url - http://LOCALHOST:8080/jira - the browser will modify the domain to lower case.
# Try to use a gadget (e.g. leave a comment on an activity stream) - an error will be thrown.

I believe other gadgets might break as well, as per the document [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options]:
{quote}
This is especially important for JIRA 4.0.x or higher, as any mismatch between this Base URL setting and the URL requested by your JIRA users will cause problems with dashboard gadgets.
{quote}

We should not allow the Base URL to be configured in a way which may break the application functionalities (e.g. gadgets, AppLinks).

A possible alternative would be following the same approach as the browsers follow: convert the domain to lower case and leave the context path as case sensitive once the user saves the Base URL.
fields.summary: JIRA does not lowercase the domain name in the Base URL

I found some Atlassian Answers that explain this has something to do with the cascading select, but I don't know what the issue actually IS. h4. Steps to Replicate the Problem:
# Install JIRA 6.3.10
# Start JIRA using {{startup.sh}}
# Install a couple of plugins. E.g.:
#* JIRA Agile;
#* JIRA Portfolio;
#* JIRA Service Desk;
# Stop JIRA using {{shutdown.sh}}

h4. Expected Behavior
JIRA would shutdown gracefully without showing errors, and the Tomcat process would be stopped.

h4. Actual Behavior
JIRA throws errors during the shutdown process, and erratically doesn't stop the Tomcat process.

h5. Workaround (for JIRA not shutting down):
Start and Shutdown JIRA using {{start-jira}} and {{stop-jira}} instead. If using JIRA WAR, use the following:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}

{noformat}
This will kill Tomcat in 300 seconds if it doesn't successfully stop before.

fields.description:
I'm using JIRA 6.3.5 and have my user profile set to Brazilian Portuguese.

As an admin I've created custom fields with names in English and had all statuses translated into Brazilian Portuguese.

When I see an issue page I can see the status ("Situação") in Portuguese, as the following snapshot shows:

!Seleção_078.png!

However, when I click on the View workflow" ("Ver Fluxo de Trabalho") link all statuses names are in English in the graph:

!Seleção_079.png!

I'd expect to see them in Portuguese on the graph too.
fields.summary: Status names appear untranslated in the "view workflow" graph
Clarify Migrating from JIRA Cloud Documentation
Add ability to create users without sending them emails.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40901].
  {panel}

Here is an extremely common use case that is not covered properly by JIRA or Confluence user picket fields:

If you copy the email contact from an email client, like Microsoft Outlook, you will end-up with something like this in the clipboard: "John Doe <john.doe@acme.com>"

If you paste this value in the user picker, it will not find you the contact even if the username and the email address do both match perfectly. 

If you paste only email address or only username it does work, but the entire idea is to make it work without having to edit the text.

I would even see it as an acceptable use to search only by email address if you paste a text formatted like the one above. The test above is the default format for email addresses, as in mail RFCs.

Think about this, is a minor code change that would increase user experience considerably.
fields.summary: Jira user pickup does not work with pasted email contacts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40900].
  {panel}

If a workflow is missing the transition : 
"Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step."

then after executing the transition on the issue, the issue status would not be updated. This is un-intuitive as its not clear for the user. I believe JIRA should give warning messages if a workflow transition is not updating the issue status.

PS: I believe this post-function is present by default, however I saw an instance today where it wasn't present. I am not sure how it got to that state.
fields.summary: Issue workflow status not updated after transition execution

We only know that the workflow images are read from <JIRA home directory>/caches/workflowimages/<Workflow's name>/xxx.png.
fields.summary: In IE8 and JIRA ver.6.2.7, how is the layout of the workflow image be configured?

fields.description:
*Summary:* 
_Default Issue Type_ parameter within the Issue Type Scheme, is being ignored for users who have created an issue in the same session or users who are switching projects.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create two projects.
# Create two new Issue Type schemes and associate one with each project.
# Set the Default Issue Type to a unique setting for each Issue Type Scheme (example: scheme 1: Task scheme 2: New Feature)
# Start browser in incognito mode
# Log in, and create an issue on project 1
# You will see the defined Issue Type, change it.
# Create another issue within the same project 

*Expected Results:*
Default Issue Type should be selected.

*Actual Results:*
The previously selected Issue Type is selected.

*Notes:*
This also happens when switching to a different project as per step 7.
I found a related issue JRA-24439, here it states this is expected behaviour, but it also states that the correct scheme value should be picked up when changing projects, which it does not currently.
fields.summary: Default Issue Type - value from Issue Type Scheme is not used.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40896].
  {panel}

Deleting custom image for project avatar will cause NPE for Edit Project.
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.project.EditProject.doDefault(EditProject.java:67)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Create a project
# Click on *Edit* for the project from projects list in administration - https://<domain>/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
# Click *select image* - upload a custom image for avatar and update/save
# Edit the project again by clicking *Edit* in project list and *select image*
# Delete the custom image by hovering the cursor on it and click *X* at the top right of the image. Close the *select image* dialogue
# Click *Update*
# The project avatar now is changed to Atlassian's Charlie instead of default rocket or broken image in project's administration page. Editing the project will throw NPE error

*Expected behavior*
The project's avatar should be set to default one(rocket icon).

*Workaround*
The project's avatar ID need to be updated from database and restart JIRA. For Atlassian OnDemand users, please create a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com under *OnDemand Support* project to get this fixed.
fields.summary: Deleting custom image for project avatar will cause NPE for Edit Project

fields.description:
The Create Issue button on the project overview page is visible for users without create issue permissions. Following the button results in an error:
{code}The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser{code}

NB.
This button will only appear when there are no issues created yet in the project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40892].
  {panel}

The advanced issue filter in JIRA is using the project name when selecting 'Project'. When the project name is changed this leads to the filter breaking .
When using the basic filter and selecting a project via the dropdown the key is correctly used instead of the name.

We are changing project names, but usually keep the project key fixed. The means that advanced filters using the project will break.

I would like to change this default behavior to use project key in basic and in advanced search. I don't see any benefit in using the project name in advanced search.
fields.summary: JIRA Default behaviour for advanced filter should use project key instead of name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40891].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When the user have the profile language in Japanese and he tries to add a date on the "Activity Stream Gadget" using the calendar function it looks like automatically add a non needed double byte value, on this case "月" that means "month" And is causing the error of the attached images, and the user is unable to select/save the specific date.
Even typing on the correct format is not possible to save it.

----------
The error if translated to english says：
入力した日付は無効です。推奨する書式は "2014/11月/14" です。
The date you entered is invalid. The recommended format is "2014/11 月 / 14".
----------

If the user changes the profile language to other language it works fine.
This was reproduced on the following versions of JIRA:
JIRA Server
6.2.7, 6.3.8, 6.3.10
JIRA Cloud
6.4-OD-09-008

h3. Workaround
- Delete '月' character and hit 'Enter' key (see [Workaround.jpg|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/171959/WorkAround.jpg] also)
fields.summary: Activity stream gadget calendar filter date selection "double byte language" error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40889].
  {panel}

I can't change the type of an issue from the edit screen. The message says "There are no issue types with compatible field configuration and/or workflow associations."

Currently, the definition of "compatible workflow" is "identical".

This is unnecessarily strict, and creates lots of overhead.

----

In my case, the workflows are almost exactly the same. They differ only in a few details, like when screens are used.

Changing the issue involves a lot of worthless steps, with only one real decision.

*Step 1:* choose the new type
*Step 2:* worthless
*Step 3:* worthless
*Step 4:* worthless

When only the type changes (status and fields staying the same), I should be able to do this without clicking through a bunch of screens. It's unnecessarily counterintuitive to my users, and it's tedious for me. 

----

If changing workflows is a dangerous action (I don't think it is), a confirmation dialog could say "This will change the issue workflow from A to B".

If changing workflows is a high-permission action (I don't think it is), it could be restricted to those with the "Move" permission.
fields.summary: Simplify changing issue type with different workflows

fields.description:

edit the custom field again.

fields.summary: Radio Buttons CF looks like crap

fields.description:
h3. Symptom

"Basic" search button not available in issue navigator where JQL query contains a username with capital letters.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an user with capital letter(s) in name (e.g. Testuser)
# Browse to the issue navigator and search for this user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# You will be able to search either in Basic or Advanced mode
# In the issue navigator using Advanced mode, search for the user either in the "reporter" or "assignee" field
# The "Basic" search will be disabled
# If you hove on the "Basic" link, the message "This query is too complex to display in Simple mode" will be shown

h3. Expected behavior

Be able to search in Basic and Advanced mode

h3. Current behavior

Basic search is disabled.

h3. Workaround

In the JQL make the capital letters lowercase in the username (e.g. testuser)
fields.summary: Usernames with capital letters disable 'Basic' search

fields.description:
I had thought this would have been done but just had a support case where the end user had white-space at the end of the address (in their user profile).  This means addons checking addresses (apart from case insensitive) need to also trim user emails every single time; addons needing to check all users need to do this for _all_ users every single time.

I can't see a reason why user email addresses would not always be trimmed of whitespace, it would be the logical place to filter, so please do that, at some point!
fields.summary: When saving user profile email addresses, they should be trimmed of whitespace

fields.description:
Hi,

we have a custom status "Planned". The workflow is the following: Open -> Planned. In this direction all works as should. But when I want to revert planning (Planned -> Open), JIRA raises an error:

<<
Workflow Error

Unable to update custom field customfield_10115 - Date Planned in issue [CS-1396].

It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
>>
I'm an administrator of JIRA. How can I solve it?

BR
Valeriy KHISAEV
fields.summary: Workflow Error on updating a custom field
